Mr Chris Huhne said the sheer scale of the solar rush meant it was sucking up green energy subsidies intended for other forms of renewable production, like wind and biomass. Large-scale solar installations weren't anticipated under the scheme we inherited and I'm concerned this could mean that money meant for people who want to produce their own green electricity has the potential to be directed towards large-scale commercial solar projects, he said. He was backed by climate change minister Greg Barker , who said projects already or nearly completed would still get the top-rate subsidy.
